trans-unit.source: Represents a sequence of glyphs from a single face of a single font at a single size, and with a single rendering style.
The GlyphRun object includes font details such as glyph indices and individual glyph positions.
In addition, The GlyphRun object contains the original Unicode code points the run was generated from, character to glyph buffer offset mapping information, and per-character and per-glyph flags.
The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Glyphs> element represents the output of a GlyphRun in XAML.
The following markup syntax is used to describe the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Glyphs> element.

[!code-xml[GlyphsOvwSamp1#1](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/t-system.windows.media.g_0_1.xaml)] [!code-xml[GlyphsOvwSamp1#1](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/t-system.windows.media.g_0_1.xaml)] Each glyph defines metrics that specify how it aligns with other <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Glyphs>.
The following graphic defines the various typographic qualities of two different glyph characters.
![Diagraph of glyph measurements](~/add/media/glyph-example.png "Diagraph of glyph measurements") Various typographic qualities of two different glyph characters ## XAML Text Usage
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref> class.
The Pixels Per Density Independent Pixel value, which is the equivalent of the scale factor.
For example, if the DPI of a screen is 120 (or 1.25 because 120/96 = 1.25) , 1.25 pixel per density independent pixel is drawn.
DIP is the unit of measurement used by WPF to be independent of device resolution and DPIs.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref> class by specifying properties of the class.
A value of type <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref>.
A value of type <xref:System.Int32>.
A value of type <xref:System.Boolean>.
A value of type <xref:System.Double>.
An array of type <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601>.

An array of type <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601>.
An array of type <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601>.
An array of type <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601>.

An array of type <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref> class by specifying properties of the class.
A value of type <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref>.
A value of type <xref:System.Int32>.
A value of type <xref:System.Boolean>.

An array of type <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601>.

An array of type <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601>.
An array of type <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601>.
An array of type <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601>.
A value of type <xref:System.String>.
An array of type <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601>.
An array of type <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601>.
A value of type <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.XmlLanguage"></xref>.
Gets or sets the list of <xref:System.Double> values that represent the advance widths corresponding to the glyph indices.
Each item in the list of advance widths corresponds to the glyph values returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun.GlyphIndices%2A> property.
The nominal origin of the n<sup>th</sup> glyph in the run (n>0) is the nominal origin of the n-1<sup>th</sup> glyph plus the n-1<sup>th</sup> advance width added along the runs advance vector.
Base glyphs generally have a non-zero advance width, whereas combining glyphs generally have a zero advance width.
## XAML Text Usage
A list of <xref:System.Double> values that represent the advance widths.
Gets or sets the baseline origin of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref>.
## XAML Text Usage
A <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> value representing the baseline origin.
Gets or sets the bidirectional nesting level of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref>.
## XAML Text Usage
An <xref:System.Int32> value that represents the bidirectional nesting level.
Retrieves the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Geometry> returned contains the combined geometry of all glyphs in the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun>.
Overlapping contours are merged by performing a Boolean union operation.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> corresponding to the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref>.

Gets or sets the list of <xref:System.Boolean> values that determine whether there are caret stops for every UTF16 code point in the Unicode representing the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref>.
The return value is `null` if there is a caret stop for every UTF16 code point in the Unicode representing the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun>.
## XAML Text Usage
A list of <xref:System.Boolean> values that represent whether there are caret stops.
Gets or sets the list of UTF16 code points that represent the Unicode content of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref>.
## XAML Text Usage
A list of <xref:System.Char> values that represent Unicode content.
Gets or sets the list of <xref:System.UInt16> values that maps characters in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref> to glyph indices.
There is one entry per character in the list.

Each value in the list gives the offset of the first glyph, represented by <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun.GlyphIndices%2A>, to the corresponding character, represented by <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun.Characters%2A>.

Where multiple characters map to a single glyph, or to a glyph group that cannot be broken down to map exactly to individual characters, the entries for all the characters have the same value: the offset of the first glyph that represents this group of characters.
If the list is `null` or equal to <xref:System.String.Empty>, sequential 1 to 1 mapping is assumed.
## XAML Text Usage
A list of <xref:System.UInt16> values that represent mapped glyph indices.
Retrieves the alignment box for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref>.
The returned <xref:System.Windows.Rect> is relative to the origin of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> that represents the alignment box for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref>.
Retrieves the ink bounding box for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref>.
The returned <xref:System.Windows.Rect> is relative to the origin of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> that represents the ink bounding box the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref>.
Gets or sets the specific device font for which the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref> has been optimized.

When a <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun> is rendered on a device that has built-in support for the named device font, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun> should be rendered using a device specific mechanism for selecting that font, and by sending Unicode code points rather than glyph indices.
When rendering onto a device that does not include built-in support for the named device font, DeviceFontName should be ignored.
## XAML Text Usage
A <xref:System.String> value that represents the device font.
Gets or sets the em size used for rendering the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref>.
## XAML Text Usage
A <xref:System.Double> value that represents the em size used for rendering.
Retrieves the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterHit"></xref> value that represents the character hit of the caret of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref>.
The `distance` value represents the offset from the leading edge of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun>.
If the hit is outside the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun>, the character hit represents the closest caret character hit within the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterHit> structure represents information about a character hit within a <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun>—the index of the first character that was hit as well as information about the leading or trailing edge.
Offset to use for computing the caret character hit.
Determines whether the character hit is inside the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref>.
A value that represents the character hit that is closest to the distance value.
The out parameter isInside returns if the character hit is inside the ; otherwise, .
Retrieves the offset from the leading edge of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref> to the leading or trailing edge of a caret stop containing the specified character hit.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun> is not hit testable, the distance of 0.0 is returned.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun.IsHitTestable%2A> property to determine if a <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun> can be hit test.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterHit"></xref> to use for computing the offset.

A <xref:System.Double> that represents the offset from the leading edge of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref> to the leading or trailing edge of a caret stop containing the character hit.
The character hit is outside the range specified by the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref> Unicode string.
Retrieves the next valid caret character hit in the logical direction in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref>.
To retrieve the previous valid caret character hit, use <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun.GetPreviousCaretCharacterHit%2A>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterHit"></xref> to use for computing the next hit value.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterHit"></xref> that represents the next valid caret character hit in the logical direction.
If the return value is equal to characterHit, no further navigation is possible in the .
Retrieves the previous valid caret character hit in the logical direction in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref>.
To retrieve the next valid caret character hit, use <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun.GetNextCaretCharacterHit%2A>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterHit"></xref> to use for computing the previous hit value.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterHit"></xref> that represents the previous valid caret character hit in the logical direction.
If the return value is equal to characterHit, no further navigation is possible in the .
Gets or sets an array of <xref:System.UInt16> values that represent the glyph indices in the rendering physical font.
The default value of the glyph indices are defined by the font's character map table for the corresponding Unicode code points in the inner text.
## XAML Text Usage
A list of <xref:System.UInt16> values that represent the glyph indices.
Gets or sets an array of <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> values representing the offsets of the glyphs in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref>.
The glyph offset values are added to the nominal glyph origin to generate the final origin for the glyph.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun.AdvanceWidths%2A> property represents the values of the nominal glyph origins for the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun>.
Base glyphs generally have a glyph offset of (0, 0), combining glyphs generally have an offset that places them correctly on top of the nearest preceding base glyph.
## XAML Text Usage
A list of <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> values representing the offsets of glyph.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref>.
## XAML Text Usage
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether there are any valid caret character hits within the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if there are valid caret character hits; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether to rotate glyphs.
If IsSideways is `true`, the glyphs that make up text characters are rotated 90° counter-clockwise, using vertical baseline positioning metrics.
## XAML Text Usage
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the glyphs are rotated; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.XmlLanguage"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref>.
## XAML Text Usage
The <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.XmlLanguage"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun"></xref>.
Get or sets the PixelsPerDip at which the text should be rendered.
The current PixelsPerDip value.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize.BeginInit%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize.EndInit%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
